alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 3:05PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Weld County through 345 PM MDT... At 305 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from 10 miles east of Rockport to 4 miles southwest of Briggsdale, or along a line extending from 20 miles southeast of Cheyenne to 22 miles northeast of Greeley. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible and wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grover, Keota, Hereford and Briggsdale. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If a tornado is spotted seek shelter inside a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County
